person.content:
Please identify the "Person" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: World number two Rodney Eyles moved within sight of his fifth title of the year on Friday when he hurried in only 40 minutes to the final of the richest squash tournament outside the World Open , the $ 105,000 Mahindra International .

Let's think step by step.

Sure! To identify the "Person" entities in the paragraph, we can look for names of individuals that are mentioned.

1. Rodney Eyles - This is the first name mentioned in the paragraph, and it is a person's name. Therefore, Rodney Eyles is a "Person" entity.

So, the "Person" entities in the paragraph are:

* Rodney Eyles
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Person.

Sure, my apologies for the mistake. Here's the revised list of "Person" entities in the paragraph:

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the revised list of "Person" entities in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Person":

| Person |
| --- |

organization.content:
Please identify the "Organization" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: World number two Rodney Eyles moved within sight of his fifth title of the year on Friday when he hurried in only 40 minutes to the final of the richest squash tournament outside the World Open , the $ 105,000 Mahindra International .

Let's think step by step.

Sure! Here are the entities in the paragraph that can be classified as "Organization":

1. World Squash Federation (WSF) - This is the governing body for squash worldwide, and it organizes the World Open, which is mentioned in the paragraph.
2. Mahindra International - This is the name of the squash tournament that Rodney Eyles moved within sight of winning. As it is a tournament, it can be classified as an organization.

So, the two organizations mentioned in the paragraph are:

1. World Squash Federation (WSF)
2. Mahindra International
